title: CCI probes IndiGo for dominance abuse, fare hikes after December flight cancellations
content: Probe report to be submitted in 90 days; order after passenger complained of buying air tickets at double the price after IndiGo cancelled his flight

title: Every single genuine person must remain on electoral roll, CJI tells West Bengal CM in Supreme Court
content: Assuring CM Mamata Banerjee, the top Court said that the Election Commission of India cannot “run away” from its Constitutional obligation to ensure that “every single genuine citizen” is included in the electoral

title: Forest department uses tech to track tiger, ropes in Pune-based experts to tranquilise it
content: At least 100 forest department personnel are monitoring the movements of the tiger 24x7, apart from the deployment of the state-of-the-art technology to tranquilize it.

title: Civic poll campaign shifts to top gear in TG
content: CM A. Revanth Reddy launches campaign from Miryalaguda, BJP national president Nitin Nabin kick-starts poll campaign from Mahabubnagar

title: Kerala to fund ₹1,900 crore for Sabari rail project
content: Cabinet decides that the State will bear 50% of the cost of the Angamaly–Erumely Sabari Railway Project and raise its share through the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board. The project — first proposed in the 1997-98 Railway Budget — has finally been set in motion after a hiatus of nearly three decades.

title: Water crisis threatens paddy fields in various panchayats in Thrissur; farmers warn of mass protests against KSEB
content: Crucial irrigation water has failed to reach paddy fields and adjoining farmlands. The shortage has put both rice cultivation and other crops under serious threat

title: Tiger made eight cattle kills over three weeks in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district
content: A special committee has been constituted to monitor the tiger’s movements and take decisions on the course of action to be adopted by the Forest department

title: Withdraw from India-U.S. trade deal: Minister
content: Flays letter from Centre demanding Kerala discontinue State Incentive Bonus provided for paddy procurement

title: M. Ravichandra to take charge as new TTD Executive Officer on February 6
content: Currently serving as Special Chief Secretary to the Chief Minister, he is entrusted with full additional charge of the new post following the transfer of incumbent Anil Kumar Singhal in the ghee adulteration case

title: Tirupati police arrest 13 for ‘abduction, assault’ of student union leaders
content: Student leaders Ali Akbar and Vinod Kumar, who were about to participate in a demonstration against Mohan Babu University (MBU), were allegedly abducted by some persons owing allegiance to the university

title: School health programme for holistic health, well being of students
content: Aksharam Arogyam programme will cover all students from Classes I to XII in all government and aided schools across the State.  Health department believes that if children are given proper awareness on various aspects of health and if they can be encouraged to develop healthy habits, they will become  ambassadors of good health

title: 'Won't be bullied, willing to wait out Trump's term for trade deal, Doval told Rubio'
content: India has finalized a significant trade deal with the US, a move that National Security Advisor Ajit Doval indicated India was willing to wait out President Trump's term for. Union Minister Piyush Goyal confirmed the agreement, emphasizing the protection of sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy. Both nations aim to more than double trade to $500 billion by 2030.

title: Ghaziabad father 'clueless' about tasks in Korean game, says daughters tossed phones and jumped
content: Three minor sisters tragically died after jumping from their ninth-floor Ghaziabad apartment, reportedly influenced by an online Korean task-based game. Their father, unaware of the game's nature, recalled the middle sister's leadership. The girls, deeply engrossed in the game and Korean content, had limited mobile access recently, potentially causing distress. Investigations are ongoing.

title: 'Getting better day by day': Rishabh Pant offers positive update on comeback
content: Rishabh Pant is recovering well and is optimistic about returning to cricket soon. He is working hard at the BCCI Centre of Excellence. Pant emphasizes the importance of his love for the game and support from others during his recovery. He believes in continuous improvement as an athlete.

title: 'Not getting justice': Mamata argues her own case in SC - what happened
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee urged the Supreme Court to intervene in the electoral roll revision, alleging the state is being targeted and its people bulldozed. The top court issued notices to the Election Commission and the state's chief electoral officer, emphasizing that genuine persons must remain on the electoral roll.

title: Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
content: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: Willow by Cricbuzz to stream Team USA T20 World Cup 2026 matches free on YouTube
content: Willow by Cricbuzz has announced major updates for the 2026 season, including free streaming of all four Team USA matches at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup on YouTube for the first time. The platform has also partnered with Jomboy Media for creator-led alternate telecasts and unveiled a revamped, faster viewing experience across its apps and devices.

title: If India stops buying Russian oil, what it could mean for Moscow’s revenues — explained
content: US President Trump's push for India to reduce Russian oil imports could significantly impact Moscow's revenue, potentially forcing price cuts. Recent data shows a notable decline in Indian purchases, with further reductions anticipated due to refinery maintenance and limited alternative buyers like China.  While India cites energy security, geopolitical pressures and alternative supply options are reshaping global oil flows.

title: Operation 'Trashi-I': One terrorist killed in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces neutralised one terrorist in Kishtwar during Operation 'Trashi-I'. This follows a series of encounters targeting Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad militants. Separately, two Pakistani terrorists, including a top JeM commander, were killed in a cave in Udhampur during Operation 'Kiya', concluding a prolonged gunfight.

title: Google may have an 'India plan' to tackle H-1B visa restrictions
content: Alphabet is significantly expanding its presence in Bangalore, India, with a massive new office complex potentially housing 20,000 employees. This strategic move aims to circumvent rising H-1B visa costs for Indian engineers in the US.  The tech giant is actively recruiting AI and engineering talent, mirroring a broader trend of Big Tech increasing its India workforce.

title: Is your car’s suspension failing? Common signs you shouldn’t ignore
content: Your car's suspension signals its decline through subtle changes. Listen for harsher rides over bumps, excessive bouncing, and strange noises. Uneven tyre wear, pulling to one side, or increased body roll during turns are also critical warnings. Ignoring these signs on India's challenging roads can lead to discomfort and safety issues. Address them promptly.

title: Early Signs Of Oral Cancer: Oncologist urges attention to persistent mouth sores
content: Oral cancer often goes unnoticed due to subtle early symptoms and societal stigma around related habits.  Dr. Vijay Haribhakti highlights that persistent mouth sores, white or red patches, and lumps, especially those lasting over two weeks, require urgent medical attention. Early detection through vigilance and regular check-ups is crucial for successful treatment.

title: Elon Musk to Peter Thiel: Your assessment is wrong, I never gave up on ...
content: Elon Musk has publicly refuted claims by Peter Thiel suggesting a loss of faith in Mars colonization. Thiel alleged Musk expressed concerns about Earth's politics and AI following humanity to other planets. Musk, however, asserted on X that his commitment to making life multiplanetary remains unwavering, emphasizing its continued importance for civilization's survival.

title: World Cup dream over for Samson? Surya confirms 'definitely Ishan' to open
content: India's T20 World Cup warm-up saw Ishan Kishan open alongside Abhishek Sharma, potentially impacting Sanju Samson's World Cup selection. Captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed the opening pair, emphasizing the team's strategy. This move follows recent shifts in batting order, with Kishan's strong form and Samson's inconsistent returns influencing management decisions.

title: 'Movers, shaker, and beggars': Pakistan's national meltdown over the India-US trade deal
content: Perhaps, Pakistan felt it had returned to its older role of indispensable intermediary as New Delhi remained the insouciant child who refused to bow to Trump’s diktats. Overnight, the illusion shattered as Trump announced the US had reached a trade agreement with India lowering tariffs on India’s exports to 18%. While most of the details about the deal are still being worked out, that didn’t stop a full-blown meltdown on Pakistani (or South Asian) Twitter.

title: Tom Homan announces withdrawal of 700 immigration agents in Minnesota
content: Around 700 federal immigration officers are leaving Minnesota following increased cooperation from state and local authorities, particularly county sheriffs. White House border czar Tom Homan announced the drawdown, citing improved collaboration and a safer environment. This move comes amid protests and fatalities linked to earlier large-scale federal deployments in the state.

title: Former LSU Standout Terrace Marshall Jr. to Join Miami Dolphins
content: The Miami Dolphins have signed former LSU wide receiver Terrace Marshall Jr. to a free agent contract. Marshall aims to revive his NFL career after struggling to find consistent success with the Carolina Panthers and brief stints with other teams. This move offers him a fresh opportunity to compete for a roster spot with the Dolphins.

title: When do the 2026 Winter Olympics start? Milan-Cortina schedule explained
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics are almost here, with the Milan Cortina Games set to begin in just a few days. Athletes from around the world are arriving in Italy for two weeks of top-level winter sports. Fans will see famous events like ice hockey, figure skating, alpine skiing, and snowboarding. Some competitions will start even before the official opening ceremony, giving viewers early action to enjoy.

title: Ben Askren net worth: The former MMA and UFC champion’s income, career, titles and more
content: Ben Askren is a former American mixed martial artist and elite wrestler. He is best known for his dominance in Bellator and ONE Championship. Askren built his reputation as one of the most skilled grapplers in combat sports. He remained undefeated for nearly a decade. While he never became a primary UFC star, his earlier success made him a big name.

title: Explosive ‘candy’ injures 3-year-old girl in Rajasthan; shopkeeper detained
content: A three-year-old girl in Alwar's Ramgarh area sustained severe mouth and jaw injuries when an explosive, allegedly disguised as candy by a shopkeeper, detonated in her mouth. The child is recovering after surgery, and the shopkeeper has been detained for questioning as an investigation is ongoing.

title: Birthday balloons explode inside Mumbai lift, 2 injured; CCTV captures chilling moment
content: A young student, Himani Tapriya, sustained severe burns after dozens of gas-filled balloons exploded in a lift at Amol Tower, Goregaon. The incident occurred when a delivery man, Raju Kumar Mahato, entered the lift with the balloons. Police have registered a negligence case against the shop owner for failing to provide safety instructions to his employee, who also suffered injuries.

title: India-US trade deal decoded: What does it mean for economy, markets & Russian oil imports?
content: India and the US have announced a framework for a bilateral trade deal to strengthen trade ties, under which the US will cut tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 50%. The Centre has clarified that agriculture and dairy remain protected, while sectors such as textiles, leather and gems may benefit.

title: Rahul's 'traitor' remark on Bittu snowballs into controversy - top developments
content: Rahul Gandhi's "traitor friend" jibe at BJP MP Ravneet Singh Bittu during a Parliament protest has sparked outrage. BJP leaders condemned the remark as unacceptable and offensive to the Sikh community, demanding an apology. Bittu retaliated, accusing Congress of atrocities against Sikhs and calling them "murderers."

title: Oppn, BJP MPs spar in Speaker office as Nishikant Dubey flashes 'Bofors' book in LS to target Gandhi family
content: Lok Sabha witnessed heated exchanges as opposition MPs protested BJP's Nishikant Dubey targeting the Gandhi family with book references. Following adjournment, Congress MPs met Speaker Om Birla, while Union Minister Kiren Rijiju was also present. This follows earlier disruptions over former Army chief's memoir and Rahul Gandhi's disallowed quotes.

title: 9 editions, no home winners: The strange history of the T20 World Cup
content: India secured their second T20 World Cup title in 2024, defeating South Africa in a thrilling final. This victory ended an 11-year drought and added to their inaugural win in 2007. The tournament has seen six different champions across nine editions, with a curious trend of host nations never winning the title.

title: ‘As good as Bradman’: Tragic life of prodigy Archie Jackson who died aged 23
content: Almost a century ago, on February 4, 1929, 19-year-old Archie Jackson, hailed as Bradman's equal, achieved his sole Test century in his debut Ashes match for Australia. This stunning 164 was the highlight of a tragically short career. Jackson played only eight Tests before succumbing to tuberculosis at 23, leaving behind a legacy of immense promise.

title: AI reimagines K3G cast: George Clooney, Meryl Streep and Tom Cruise go viral
content: Filmmaker Karan Johar reacted with amusement to an AI-generated video reimagining Hollywood stars in his iconic film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. Meryl Streep as Nandini and George Clooney as Yashvardhan were highlighted, with Johar jokingly expressing his desire to have Streep in his films.

title: Ghaziabad sisters’ deaths: How gaming habit during Covid times turned fatal
content: Three minor sisters died after allegedly jumping from a ninth-floor apartment balcony in Ghaziabad. Police are investigating mobile phone addiction and the influence of an online Korean game, noting the girls were distressed after their phone usage was restricted. A diary entry expressing sorrow was recovered.

title: Putin calls Russia–China ties a ‘stabilising force’ in video call with Xi
content: Russian President Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping lauded their "strategic" economic partnership, emphasizing energy, nuclear power, and high-tech cooperation.  The leaders affirmed mutual support for sovereignty and development paths. This high-level exchange occurs as China balances engagement with Western nations while maintaining strong ties with Moscow, despite ongoing global turbulence.

title: Indian IT stocks crash: Infosys, TCS, Wipro down up to 7% - how a US startup is cause of fall
content: Shares of major IT companies, including Infosys, Wipro, HCL Tech and Persistent Systems, slid as much as 6 per cent in early trade. The negative sentiment mirrored weakness on Wall Street, where the technology-heavy benchmark Nasdaq declined 1.4 per cent, erasing nearly $300 billion in market capitalisation across the sector.

title: Delhi to Antarctica: AIIMS doctors redefine ‘remote’ using telerobotic system
content: Doctors in Delhi successfully conducted a live ultrasound scan on a patient in Antarctica using a remotely controlled robotic arm. This groundbreaking demonstration by AIIMS highlights the potential for delivering specialist medical care across vast distances, offering a vital solution for remote and underserved regions.

title: 'We lose a piece of who we are': The slow fade of mud wrestling in heart of Old Delhi
content: Traditional wrestling akhadas in Old Delhi are facing a decline due to reduced public interest and the fading of local competitions. The Covid-19 pandemic exacerbated financial struggles and halted tournaments, leading to closures. Concerns over fixed bouts and betting have eroded spectator trust, impacting young wrestlers' aspirations and the sport's future.

title: T20 World Cup: When and where to watch IND vs SA warm-up match
content: India and South Africa will face off in their sole T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match on Wednesday, February 4, in Navi Mumbai. This fixture offers both teams a crucial final opportunity to fine-tune their strategies, batting orders, and bowling plans before the tournament commences on February 7.

title: Despite earning Rs 1 cr a year, IT professional says he can't afford a home in Gurgaon
content: Young professionals in Gurugram express deep frustration over exorbitant property prices, finding little value for their money despite high salaries.  A Reddit discussion highlights the disconnect between the city's aspirational image and the reality of poor construction, inadequate infrastructure, and a lack of trust in builders, leaving many questioning their decision to live and invest there.

title: India-US trade deal: Kharge questions secrecy around pact; seeks clarity in Parliament
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge questioned the India-US trade deal's announcement, citing a lack of parliamentary and public consultation. He contrasted it with the transparent Indo-US civil nuclear agreement. Kharge raised concerns about potential compromises, zero tariffs on US imports, and the impact on Indian farmers and Russia oil trade, demanding full disclosure.

title: Father, his 2 wives who are sisters, 5 children - all lived together before triple suicide
content: Three minor sisters, aged 12, 14, and 16, died after jumping from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad residence. Police are investigating the incident, focusing on the girls' alleged addiction to a Korean online game and excessive mobile phone use. Family members had recently restricted their phone access, reportedly causing distress.

title: 'Kept hidden under bed box': 12-year-old employed as house help rescued from Guwahati house
content: A 12-year-old child labourer was rescued from a residence in Guwahati's Panjabari area on Sunday night. Found in poor condition with signs of abuse, the girl had been working as a domestic help for six years. Employers Amarin Akhtar Lashkar and Baharul Haque Lashkar were booked by Dispur police after initially denying the child's presence.

title: Consent to a relationship does not permit filming or online abuse, rules Delhi High Court
content: The complainant, who was a married woman residing in Delhi with her children, while her husband worked in Gujarat, came into contact with the accused due to family ties

title: 'Justice crying behind closed door': Mamata in SC, leads charge against SIR
content: West Bengal chief minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee approached the Supreme Court to contest the Election Commission's special intensive revision exercise. She had previously met with the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar to voice her objections, alleging humiliation during the encounter. A Supreme Court bench is set to hear the matter.

title: 'Two fell while trying to save the third': Man who saw Ghaziabad sisters jump from 9th floor at 2am
content: Three minor sisters tragically died after jumping from a ninth-floor Ghaziabad flat early Wednesday. An eyewitness reported one sister appeared to plan the jump, while the other two fell trying to stop her. Police are investigating their alleged addiction to an online gaming app and a handwritten note found at the scene.

title: Data Centres To Replicate Internet-Era Job Boom In India: NVIDIA CEO Huang
content: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang said that AI infrastructures such as data centres can recreate the "incredible" scale of jobs that the internet did when it reached the Indian market.

title: In Madhya Pradesh Police Department, A Scam Worth Crores, Suicide By Cop
content: It began as a routine audit of travel allowance bills, but turned into one of the most embarrassing scandals to hit the police department in years, leading to the death of a young constable.

title: is "Pir Panjal" A Region? Chaos In J&K Assembly Over BJP MLA's Comment
content: A heated clash broke out in the Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly today between the BJP and Congress legislators over the use of the word "Pir Panjal" for the border districts of Poonch and Rajouri.

title: After Protests, US Border Czar Says Removing 700 ICE Agents From Minnesota
content: US border czar Tom Homan on Wednesday announced the removal of 700 immigration enforcement personnel from Minnesota after weeks of operations and the fatal shooting of two protesters that sparked outrage.

title: Madhya Pradesh's Van Vihar National Park Drawn Into 'Fake Meat Scam' Probe
content: The investigation into the alleged beef racket and fake meat licence scam in Madhya Pradesh's capital has reached the gates of Van Vihar National Park, one of the city's most sensitive wildlife zones.

title: Upset Over India-US Trade Deal, Punjab Farmers Plan Mega Protest
content: The farmers in Punjab, upset over the US-India trade deal, plan to hold a protest tomorrow in front of residence of the Chief Minister, and several ministers and MLAs in the state.

title: Yumnam Khemchand Singh Sworn In As Manipur Chief Minister, Gets 2 Deputies
content: Yumnam Khemchand Singh took oath as the new Chief Minister of Manipur this evening. Along with him, Deputy Chief Ministers Nemcha Kipgen and Losii Dikho, and the state's new Home Minister Govindas Konthoujam took oath.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Day 3 Highlights: Lok Sabha Adjourned, PM Modi Won't Speak Today
content: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Day 3 Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the Lok Sabha at 5 pm, as a standoff continues between the Treasury and Opposition benches.

title: Woman Dies As Roof Of Rented House Collapses In Delhi: Cops
content: A 60-year-old woman died after a portion of the roof of her rented house collapsed in northeast Delhi's Brahampuri area, police said on Wednesday.

title: Xi, Putin Discuss Global Security, Shower Praises On Each Other In Call
content: China's President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin both hailed their ties during a video call on Wednesday held in the run-up to the fourth anniversary of Moscow's war in Ukraine.

title: Months After Mass Cancellations, Competition Panel Orders Probe Against IndiGo
content: The Competition Commission on Wednesday ordered a detailed probe against IndiGo for unfair business practices, little over two months after the country's largest airline cancelled thousands of flights due to operational issues.

title: Air India Checks Fuel Switches On Dreamliners, Says No Issues Found
content: Air India on Wednesday said it has completed the precautionary inspection of fuel control switches across its operational Boeing 787 fleet, and no issues were identified during the checks.

title: 3 Terrorists Killed In Twin Encounters In Jammu And Kashmir
content: Three terrorists were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu and Kashmir today. In a precision strike, security forces blasted a cave hideout in Udhampur's Basantgarh area, killing two terrorists.

title: Angry Sun Puts India At Risk, ISRO Warns Of Strong Radio Blackout
content: The Sun is angry again, unleashing a series of powerful solar flares that have triggered warnings from space agencies across the world, including India's ISRO, which is closely monitoring the situation for potential strong radio blackout conditions.

title: Opinion: Blog | Salman Khan, Now Rohit Shetty: The Bishnoi Threat Isn't New For Bollywood
content: The recent attacks on Rohit Shetty and Salman Khan have rekindled flashes from a chapter many thought had long been buried.

title: Video: 20-km Jam On Mumbai-Pune Expressway After Gas Tanker Overturns
content: It is a nightmare, 20 km long, and over 24 hours later it's not over yet. Hundreds of commuters including women and children are stranded on the Khandala Ghat section of the Mumbai-Pune Expressway after a tanker overturned and started leaking gas.

title: Video: Cluster Of Gas-Filled Balloons Explodes In Mumbai Lift, 2 Injured
content: For a group of people who entered an elevator in a building in Mumbai, it seemed like just another uneventful day. But CCTV footage showed otherwise.

title: Women MPs Surrounded PM's Seat: Inside Story Of Lok Sabha Chaos
content: The ruckus in the Lok Sabha that led to the cancellation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's reply to the Vote of Thanks following the President's address, had started early on Wednesday.

title: Renowned Sociologist Andre Beteille Dies In Delhi At 91
content: Noted sociologist and writer Andre Beteille died due to age-related illness at a hospital here on Tuesday night. He was 91.

title: Karuvannur bank polls an attempt to whitewash loot, says Thrissur DCC president Joseph Tajet
content: Congress to boycott election; alleges CPI(M)-BJP nexus, questions Pinarayi’s silence on Sabarimala gold controversy and unresolved depositors’ crisis

title: Elaborate arrangements for Srinivasa Mangapuram Brahmotsavam
content: TTD Joint Executive Officer instructs officials to undertake extensive publicity through campaign vehicles in the nearby villages to encourage local participation at the festival which will be held from February 8 to 16

title: Education Minister urges Canadian varsities to establish India campuses
content: University presidents from Canadian Universities are currently in India to explore opportunities for research collaboration, academic exchange, and sustainable models of transnational education

title: Sabarimala gold case: Kerala HC says SIT probe is progressing in the right direction
content: Court says statutory bail will not derail the investigation. HC makes the observations while hearing a plea by BJP State president seeking a CBI probe

title: IMHANS yet to have a full-time director
content: The post has remained vacant after the demise of P. Krishnakumar, long-time director of the institute, last year

title: Vigilance arrests priest in Sabarimala ghee embezzlement case
content: Devaswom employees entrusted with sale of ghee manipulated stock records and failed to remit the full proceeds to the board’s account, leading to a loss of ₹36,24,400

title: JSP leader alleges YSRCP corruption in Tirumala laddu row
content: The contract to supply ghee was given by YSRCP to a company that was not involved in the dairy business, claims T.C. Varun

title: No compromise with extremism, no apology for faith: Binoy Viswam
content: CPI leader says LDF will protect all religious institutions, punish the guilty in Sabarimala case, and resist BJP’s ‘constitutional assault’ on Kerala

title: Police step up crackdown on unaccounted money in Kozhikode
content: The total seizure of unaccounted money was around ₹10 crore in various flash inspections conducted in northern Kerala districts within the past five years

title: Govt. considering setting up LP school at Elambra: Minister
content: The Supreme Court had last year upheld a High Court directive asking the Kerala government to set up government lower and upper primary schools in areas where none were functioning

title: Naidu approves ‘Svayam’ as brand name for Dwacra products
content: The Chief Minister directs officials to elicit the opinion of Dwacra associations before finalising the logo

title: A.P. CM tells officials to focus on BC welfare, micro entrepreneurship
content: Plans are afoot to establish a BC residential school in every constituency and elevate BC study circles to the next level, says the Chief Minister

title: Court to deliver verdict on Potti’s bail plea on Thursday
content: He seeks statutory bail in case involving misappropriation of gold from the doorframe of Sabarimala temple’s sanctum sanctorum

title: Allahabad High Court verdict on holding prayers in private property hailed
content: The court had ruled that holding of prayers within private premises was allowed by law and there was no need for seeking prior permission of the authorities

title: V. Kunhikrishnan’s book released amid tight security
content: Book release comes against the backdrop of sustained attack by CPI(M) leaders after Kunhikrishnan raised allegations of embezzlement of a ‘martyr’s fund’ by the party. A large crowd turned up for the event

title: Census 2027: Denotified, nomadic, semi-nomadic tribes seek separate column
content: DNTs seek “separate column” in 2027 caste census, claiming they have been politically misclassified among SC, ST, OBC groups; also want sub-classification to recognise that nomadic communities need more help

title: Singapore delegation visits Machilipatnam port site
content: Megha Engineering Infrastructure Limited official tells the delegation that the first phase of the port construction, comprising four berths, will be completed by December 31

title: Mohanlal’s ivory case paves way for general amnesty scheme to declare wildlife trophies
content: The State Forest Department will soon come out with a notification enabling the general public to declare the wildlife trophies in their possession by invoking Section 40 (4) of the Wildlife Protection Act 1972. Once declared, the owners will get ownership certificates for the articles and immunity from any legal action

title: Actor Rajendra Prasad meets Pawan Kalyan
content: The Deputy Chief Minister congratulates the actor on being selected for the coveted Padma Shri award for his contribution to the field of cinema

title: IndiGo flight cancellations impacted over 9 lakh passengers in December: DGCA data
content: According to the DGCA data, flight delays impacted 8.34 lakh passengers, and airlines spent ₹4.50 crore towards facilitation in December.

title: Madras High Court closes contempt proceedings initiated against Keezhaikaatru publishers for reported book against Justice G.R. Swaminathan
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan close the case after being told that no such book was published or sold at the Chennai Book Fair 2026

title: VTU to adopt 680 govt. high schools under National Service Scheme
content: The NSS, which was previously limited to universities and colleges, has been extended to high schools for the first time in the country in 2018-19 to instill a sense of social responsibility and service among students

title: Insults fly as Rahul Gandhi, Ravneet Bittu trade ‘traitor’ and ‘enemy of the country’ jibes
content: A heated exchange during Opposition protests in the Parliament complex spiralled into a wider controversy, prompting protests and counter-accusations from Congress and BJP

title: Cardamom harvest hit by unusual cold spell in Idukki
content: Delay in maturation of cardamom capsules resulted in fewer harvests and substantial income loss in December and January

title: Raw material shortage hits pencil slat industry
content: Manufacturers allege that plywood industry is aggressively outbidding them for softwoods from Vatta and Ilavu, the most suitable for pencil production

title: Former MLA alleges Jagan regime meted out injustice to Rayalaseema
content: Byreddy Rajasekhar Reddy challenges the YSRCP leaders to a debate on the development achieved in the region during the TDP and YSRCP regimes

title: Questions on caste for the Census will be notified before the second phase: Home Ministry to Parliament
content: As reported by The Hindu, the final questionnaire for caste enumeration is likely to be known only in September, when the second phase of Census 2027 will be carried out in Ladakh and the snow-bound areas of J&K, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand, ahead of the rest of the country

title: A.P. all set to unveil Water Policy 2026-27 on February 5
content: The comprehensive policy aims at making the State drought-resilient while ensuring equitable water allocation for domestic, irrigation, industrial, aquaculture, and other uses

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Harden traded to Cavs: Excited to chase 1st title
content: The Clippers are trading James Harden to the Cavaliers for Darius Garland and a second-round pick, sources told ESPN, in a trade that Harden said "both sides got what they wanted."

title: Winfield's INT of Burrow seals NFC's Pro Bowl win
content: Buccaneers safety Antoine Winfield Jr. jumped a route to intercept Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow to seal the NFC's 66-52 comeback win against the AFC in the league's third Pro Bowl flag football game Tuesday night.

title: Coach: 'No doubt' Vonn races despite ACL injury
content: Lindsey Vonn, who ruptured her ACL in a downhill crash five days ago, is performing box jumps, working out in a pool while wearing a weighted vest and skiing at high speed as she still plans to compete at the Olympics.

title: Washington Post eliminates sports department
content: The Washington Post is eliminating its sports department as part of a mass layoff of one-third of its staff across all departments, the news outlet announced Wednesday.

title: Sources: LeBron expects to finish year with Lakers
content: LeBron James is expected to finish out the season with the Lakers, league sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Bryce James, son of LeBron, to redshirt for Arizona
content: Bryce James, youngest son of NBA star LeBron James, is going to redshirt his freshman season at Arizona, coach Tommy Lloyd confirmed Tuesday.

title: Sources: Celtics land Vucevic in trade with Bulls
content: The Celtics added some much-needed frontcourt help, acquiring Nikola Vucevic from the Bulls for Anfernee Simons and a second-round draft pick, sources told ESPN.

title: Harden for Garland: Grading this NBA point guard blockbuster
content: James Harden is a Cavalier. Darius Garland is a Clipper. Kevin Pelton grades each side of the Cleveland-Los Angeles trade.

title: Ranking the top 12 men's Coach of the Year contenders at midseason
content: From Fred Hoiberg and the turnaround he's authored at Nebraska to usual suspects, see who made the short list.

title: Bracketology: The good, and the less good, about Illinois' recent success
content: The Fighting Illini are the top 2-seed -- with plenty of time this season to move further up the board.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Benoît Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.
